intro: Serapias alba, commonly known as the white serapias, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rockcress (Capparaceae) and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the end of the stems. Serapias alba is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of mountainous regions.
